lines.text: CURRENT TOBACCO QUESTIONS
Note:
Here are some of the questions people frequently ask. These
aren't meant to limit your inquiries, but only to indicate the
diversity of issues Tobacco Institute representatives discuss.
The tobacco industry has labeled the release of the 15th
anniversary Surgeon General's Report a "media event." Why?
Aren't you really worried that HEw Secretary Califano's "war
on smoking" is going to cut into cigarette sales? .
The Tobacco Institute often points out that it doesn't pro-
mote smoking. If that's the case, what is your purpose?
A l978 Gallup poll found 20% of the people would support a
total prohibition of cigarette sales. Is prohibition ahead?
What's your industry's view on proposals like the one voters
rejected in California to ban smoking in public places?
Some of those states and communities where it's now illegal
to smoke in public say it protects health. What do you say?
An HEw scientist, Dr. Gio Gori, published a paper on *less
hazardous" cigarettes. Do you accept his conclusions?
How do you answer the charge that it's inconsistent for HEw
to fight smoking while the USDA subsidizes tobacco growing?
What's the impact of tobacco in this country in terms of how
many people smoke, numbers'of cigarettes sold and taxes paid?
There's a recurring rumor about the cigarette companies being
geared up for legalized marijuana. Will you tell us about it?
THE TOBACCO INSTITUTE
1776 'K' STREET NW
WASHINGTON DC 20006
